intro: Pycnobotrya multiflora, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, often covering the entire plant. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and a woody stem structure, making it suitable for both ornamental and hedging purposes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade conditions. Pycnobotrya multiflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
